intro: Psychotria woodii, commonly known as the "Columbian coffee plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Psychotria woodii is often found in shaded, humid environments such as understories of tropical forests.
